snippet: Macy’s said that it would close 14 stores but also open two new locations, while J. C. Penney said that it would close about 40 stores this year.
abstract: Macy's announces plan to close 14 stores and open two new locations, resulting in annual savings of about $140 million; J C Penney, in separate announcement, says it will close about 40 stores and cut about 2,250 jobs in 2015.
lead_paragraph: Macy’s said that it would close 14 stores but also open two new locations, while J. C. Penney said that it would close about 40 stores this year.

headline.main: Macy’s and J.C. Penney to Close Stores
headline.print_headline: Macy’s and J.C. Penney Announce Store Closings
